meanings.definition: To hold someone closely in one's arms.
meanings.sent1: She embraced her friend tightly after not seeing her for a long time.
meanings.sent2: The mother embraced her child to show love and comfort.
meanings.sent3: The bear tried to embrace the tree, thinking it was a friend.
meanings.sent4: The vines seemed to embrace the old house, covering it completely.
meanings.sent5: The warm blanket embraced her, making her feel safe and cozy.

meanings.definition: To accept or support willingly and enthusiastically.
meanings.sent1: The team embraced the new strategy for winning the game.
meanings.sent2: She embraced the opportunity to learn a new skill.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to embrace the idea of being a detective, solving mysteries around the house.
meanings.sent4: The town embraced the idea of going green, planting trees everywhere.
meanings.sent5: His heart embraced the kindness of strangers, feeling grateful for their help.

meanings.sent1: The package will embrace a surprise gift for you.
meanings.sent2: The book will embrace a thrilling adventure story.
meanings.sent3: The recipe will embrace a secret ingredient to make it extra delicious.
meanings.sent4: The plan will embrace a fun activity for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent5: The box will embrace a special treasure waiting to be discovered.
